website_summaries.verdict: This fixed broadhead is ideal for all types of bows and can be resharpened time and time again.
pros: Features diamond-cut sharpness backed by a honing process to maximize the blade edge
Carbon steel construction guarantees the broadhead will maintain its quality for an extended period of time
Spin tested to insure true flight
Can penetrate flesh, hide, and bone
cons: More expensive than many other fixed broadheads
Tends to fly true only up to about 40 yards

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadhead. Incredible Penetration
customer_reviews.text: I have shot a lot of different broadheads over the years and for steep angles from elevation mechanical heads have frequently had issues with penetration when contacting bone. You can see from the picture that G5 Montecs don't have a problem blowing right through ribs or any other bone they contact. They hit like a hammer and I can count on a pass through regardless of the shot angle. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: IL Bow Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Just made my first kill 10/13/2018 with this broadhead from my Hoyt Prodefiant Turbo (ATA 350 fps). Realistically it probably shoots about 295-305 fps. I got a heart shot but hit the deer in the should bone. The arrow penetrated completely through the right shoulder bone, through the deer's heart, out of the deer's body cavity, and partially into the deer's right leg. No deflection and the arrow busted through the bone like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing broadheads. Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Amazing broadheads. Sharp, durable, and the big selling point for me is that they can easily be re-sharpened. Very easily. Their shape allows you to simply place iron a wet stone and move it back and forgot sharpen them. You can shoot this broad head into the dirt, clean it, sharpen it, and use it again. I prefer the carbon steel if you plan to re-sharpen. It takes a better edge and with less effort than stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: John Wernly

customer_reviews.title: Plan on sharpening these out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I like the carbon steel because it sharpens better than stainless. These aren't sharp enough out of the box but will give you a good edge with a little work. I dropped a nice Impala with one. Got good penetration through both sides. They are tough and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Porter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with mechanicals not opening properly. Yesterday I took a doe on public land the arrow passed completely through and the deer ran 60 yards and fell dead. Broadhead can be sharpened and used again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Birt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t fly straight
customer_reviews.text: Past 25 yards, these fly off course. One out of three shots were flyers. I tested this multiple times after testing to see if the arrows were straight. Maybe they work for others, but not on my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: MBW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome broadheads they fly like field tips
customer_reviews.text: Awesome broadheads they fly like field tips. Was able to keep consistent groups. I only 4 starred bc I haven’t arrowed any animals to know how well the they cut but they came out of the package sharp
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hager

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Wow why do we mess with 100gr. Knowing 125gr will give us better penetration I finally switched. I took a 8pt buck on Sept 29th quartering away slightly. Took the shot and I thought I missed as I saw my arrow sticking in the ground. It actually blew right through his chest and out his breast plate! Never had a arrow pass through like that. Ran about 40 yards and watched it drop. No tracking needed. So if your thinking them... your thinking correct.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Great Broadhead they go right on through. I have used them for 10yrs and they work the best. My Mathews Switchback Bow performs best with the Monotect 100 gr. Just took another 2nd deer tonight Monotec, even a radical quartering shot they perform excellent
customer_reviews.author: gregory w. burnett

customer_reviews.title: Sent me practice heads not hunting heads ruined hunt.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered so I could hunt last few days of late elk season. Broadheads showed up and were preseason practice heads. Ruined my weekend. Should have gone to cabelas
customer_reviews.author: jack boysen

customer_reviews.title: Scary, sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I truly understand what folks mean when they say "scary, sharp broadheads." They lay at the perfect angle on the diamond stone for resharpening and hold an edge very well.
customer_reviews.author: craig pitmon

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Great broadheads. I was able to tune them to fly the same as my field points. These are also easy to sharpen. Carbon steel does rust.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Arkansas

customer_reviews.title: Significantly sharper
customer_reviews.text: They are significantly sharper and they stay much sharper than the stainless variety. I have shot a few deer with the same broadhead and it sharpens right back up.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Kilmer

customer_reviews.title: They are excellent in flight and on game
customer_reviews.text: Just switched to these from the only other brand I've ever used. I've only used them through one season. They are excellent in flight and on game. Also hold up well as they pass through and are easy to touch up as far as sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C. Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product - so sharp it went right threw the button buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy
customer_reviews.text: My favorite broad head. Actually I like the CS version. But they perform very well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Treguboff

customer_reviews.title: They are not true in accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these but accuracy is most important thing in bow hunting. I tuned my bow to these and ended up have to changing broadheads and retuning before season. Also I had to sharpen them right out of the package. Slick marketing but not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ian wadsworth

customer_reviews.title: accuracy
customer_reviews.text: no moving parts ! less is more ! i have been shooting most of my life (55now) and these broadheads flew like darts and gave me my first robinhood!!!! easy to sharpen too
customer_reviews.author: Avlynn

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Great broadhead, highly recommend tuning your bow with the preseason tip before throwing these on and heading out for the day to hunt.
customer_reviews.author: The Outdoor Firefighter

customer_reviews.title: Bent with one shot
customer_reviews.text: This was my first shot with this into the shoulder of a whitetail. I would have expected better based on the price and carbon steal. Never will I buy this again. The tip and the blade both bent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead, holds it edge really well and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Shoots straight and cuts well - grouping within 5 inches at 60 yards (spread probably due to user error). I had one pass through a cow elk at 50 yards without a sound. Another went into a large bull elk, passed through some shoulder muscle, and still got both lungs. Both animals were down within about 20 seconds. Great broadhead, holds it edge really well and I never had any rust or other issues.
customer_reviews.author: F. Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: really nice, haven't gotten an anima with them yet
customer_reviews.text: really nice, haven't gotten an anima with them yet. but i didn't even think about carbon steel and rain. pulled one from the quiver and it was rusted, my bad but keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Snider

customer_reviews.title: HANDS DOWN THE BEST BROADHEADS AVAILABLE
customer_reviews.text: Strongest, most accurate Broadheads, they are nothing to play around with. shoot great, best vaule as well
customer_reviews.author: alex emmanoyil

customer_reviews.title: For life!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on a reference from a friend. These thing have my bet for life.
customer_reviews.author: patrick guzman

customer_reviews.title: shoots like a feild piont tip
customer_reviews.text: Solid an sharp love the fact you can sharpen with Flat Diamond sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: BWM

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't shoot any other broad head.
customer_reviews.text: Use them on my Killer Instinct cross bow. They shoot right on same placement as the field point.
customer_reviews.author: Willis B.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, was getting my buddy into bow hunting, we both used G5 no deer but had a excellent coyote hunt the other day and tracking was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great broadheads. Love the look and they're very strong and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: Good broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Nice broadheads. Out of the six, 2 were razor sharp. Had to sharpen the others. They would have been use able as they were I'm sure but I like them scary sharp.recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shwanky1

customer_reviews.title: Nice cut
customer_reviews.text: These cut very well this deer season - didn't have a deer go more than 40 yards - the cheaper SS ones are also good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Meether

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Excited to try out this fall. My buddy uses these and he has great results! Quick, Clean, Lethal
customer_reviews.author: Mike Maher

customer_reviews.title: The BMW of broadheads.
customer_reviews.text: One of the sexiest and most effective broadheads on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only broadhead I'll use
customer_reviews.text: Have used these to take several deer and turkey over the last few years. Always make tracking easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kane Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: Great penetrating power. Actually saw one go completely thru a 55 Gallon barrel unscathed,
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: wow. good product
customer_reviews.text: WOW. light sharp, I want more but they are spendy
customer_reviews.author: BossHunt

customer_reviews.title: I used to use mechanicals but after using these I'll ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to use mechanicals but after using these I'll never go back. Two packs of these and I've gotten six deer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Potter

customer_reviews.title: love the Montec
customer_reviews.text: been using G 5 products for years field point accuracy and vicious to game
customer_reviews.author: Kiai

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I used it for deer and elk ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used it for deer and elk last year and this year. They are very precise.
customer_reviews.author: gemstatereader

customer_reviews.title: These heads fly like field points, Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sharp, well built heads, they shoot like field points.
customer_reviews.author: Coho

customer_reviews.title: Best broadhead ever
customer_reviews.text: Thought these were just a passing fad, but boy was I wrong! These things fly just like my field tips, right on target with no micro adjusting needed. Very sharp right out of the package and so easy to sharpen! A ten year old can sharpen these in about 5 minutes each. Very tough. Shot them into my ethafoam target and into the straw backstop and they keep coming out with no damage whatsoever. I would recommend these to anyone who is serious about bowhunting." [...]
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent broadhead! Stays shape! Have had super good luck with all the game I've used them on!
customer_reviews.author: Delos Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: First year with a crossbow four deer and a turkey
customer_reviews.author: William J Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great broad heads, straight through and dropped at a short distance
customer_reviews.author: Staci Bymaster

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Company
customer_reviews.text: I live in Memphis Mi. and that is where g5 makes these broadheads. They have a great rep. in our community. Been using the broadheads since they started making them. Love them. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Best BH on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Pass through heart shot on a CO elk at 50 yards. I have used the same BH for multiple successful big game CO hunts. These suckers are sharp and hold an edge!
customer_reviews.author: GMcC

customer_reviews.title: After falling for the rage hype and losing two big ...
customer_reviews.text: After falling for the rage hype and losing two big deer, switched back to these. One solid piece. Consistent and deadly.
customer_reviews.author: IndianPirate

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Razor sharp blades. Have full confidence bringing these into the woods.
customer_reviews.author: BAC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best broadhead I have ever used. Great blood tral on my hog.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrette Brathwaite

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sharp out of the box, have not harvested anything with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: joe bia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very pleased with the timely shipment of product and quality
customer_reviews.author: rrelyea_god

customer_reviews.title: good broadhead
customer_reviews.text: These carbon steel montecs are much easier to get sharp than the original montecs. Very consistant broadheads as far as weight and accuracy. Put them on a grain scale....you will be amazed at how close they are in weight. Also very rugged in design. If you are looking for a great fixed blade head, these are the ones.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrow went clean threw on my hog and black buck will use again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best broadhead on the market A must have for every serious Archer, You will not regret this purchase one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Dutzman

customer_reviews.title: but just couldn't get them to fly like my field points
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 4 only because they don't fly similar to my field points. They shoot left several inches. I spent several days tuning the bow (paper, walk back tuning, aligning vanes, etc., etc.), but just couldn't get them to fly like my field points. Groupings were also larger than with my field points.
customer_reviews.author: 124XL

customer_reviews.title: these things are great! not field tested yet with a LIVE subject ...
customer_reviews.text: these things are great! not field tested yet with a LIVE subject (probably never - hope) )but it looks great on my arrows specially with those menacing looks... quite intimidating for those who see it. bought another set of 3 to complete my quiver set...
customer_reviews.author: allan trajano

customer_reviews.title: G5s never fly true after 40 yards. Im a ...
customer_reviews.text: G5s never fly true after 40 yards. Im a big spot and stalk 40-60 yards average shot hunter and these just dont cut it. Get SWHACKERS
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Razors
customer_reviews.text: Great, sharp blades. Shoots well. Took down a buck at 53 yards with a perfect shot—dropped dead. Definitely begins to rust quickly with little moisture (as noted in product description), so keep them well cleaned and maintained.
customer_reviews.author: Durough

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is excellent. I haven't hunted with them yet
customer_reviews.text: These broad heads came very sharp. I wanted them for their simplicity. Build quality is excellent. I haven't hunted with them yet, when I do I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Cut on contact  !!
customer_reviews.text: These are my go too tips. Shot a very large bull elk this year with complete pass thru. FMJ arrows, 100 grain tip along with 50 grain insert. May be a heavy set up but it works very well together. Never have had an issue with whitetails, always a good blood trail. Expanding tips may deflect off of bone.
customer_reviews.author: WI, Bowman

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the durability of these broadheads and they ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the durability of these broadheads and they can be sharpened/resharpened to be just as if not more sharp than any other broadhead as well.
customer_reviews.author: James Hansen

customer_reviews.title: G5 , best archery products ever made
customer_reviews.text: I have no Affiliation with this company; they just make superior products period! Broad head flys just like a field point, has always passed through deer and turkeys. Make a gaping wound with easy to follow blood trail. Most all deer drop with in 50 to 60 yards. I have killed deer with these at ranges to 57 yards so far. 60 pound draw weight.
customer_reviews.author: Bob'in hood

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy points, but expensive and requires extra practice
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is great, and they are sturdier than most broadheads, but they significantly change the flight path from the same weight target points, so you really need to get the matching Montec practice points as well for sighting-in. Trying to practice with the practice broadheads is a pain and tears up your target.
customer_reviews.author: Martin W

customer_reviews.title: Great edge, fits Parker bolts, will kill a deer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not complicated. I wanted something that is reusable, durable, holds an edge, and won't fail for killing deer. The 10 pointer on my property will likely fall to this broadhead... came nice and sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Macfarlan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flight characteristics and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: 104 yards entered top of shoulder, took out heart and lung, and passed through. Not bad on a 6x6 Bull Elk. I have found these easy to sharpen, fly true, and "simple" .
customer_reviews.author: P Jones

customer_reviews.title: Rather good
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy, and having shot it about ten times I notice no problems. Blades stay sharp, and the material has no problems. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was Expecting. They are not very ...
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was Expecting. They are not very durable. 1 shot into my 18-1 target and the point broke off. these are one time use broadheads
customer_reviews.author: Bryan, and Steph

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: The pack I received was damaged and one of the tips of the rear blade was nicked off. Sent it back. I'm going to stick with Magnus Stingers.
customer_reviews.author: JD

product_meta.title: G5 Outdoors Montec 100 Grain Carbon Steel Premium Broadheads. Simple to Use, High Performance Broadhead.,3 Pack
feature_bullets: Perfect for all bows. Easily re-sharpened after repeated use
Diamond Cut Sharpness With An Additional Honing Process to Maximize Blade Edge
